Package Server.Models

Class UserModel

java.lang.Object
Server.Models.UserModel
public class UserModel
extends java.lang.Object
Contains the user data access methods Allows access to user permissions, for validation

    • setUserPassword

      public boolean setUserPassword​(java.lang.String Username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String salt) throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException, java.sql.SQLException
      Sets the password of the given user This just writes the record into the database. The provided password must already be hashed in the UserController.setUserPassword() method before calling this method Will update the internal user fields (username, password, etc)
      Parameters:
      Username - the username of the user to update
      password - the password hash to store in the database
      Returns:
      true if the update was a success, or false if it was not
      Throws:
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      java.sql.SQLException

    • createuser

      public boolean createuser​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String salt) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the new user
      password - unshased new password
      name - name of new user
      Returns:
      if sucsessfull returns 1
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser​(java.lang.String Username) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Parameters:
      Username -
      Returns:
      if successful
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • setPermissions

      public boolean setPermissions​(int userID, int create_billboards, int edit_billboards, int schedule_billboards, int edit_users)
      Sets the user permissions for the given user. This will destructively set permissions. Any existing permissions will be erased. Will update the internal user fields (username, password, etc)
      Parameters:
      userID - the user id to set permissions for
      permissions - the permissions to set
      Returns:
      true if the operation was a success or false if it failed
